originalText:
::It doesn't take too long for you to finally meet the sergeant. He stands before you proud and solid as a rock, displaying a stern face only slightly diluted by worry and uncertainty. A salute appears almost instantly, and his spoken words aren't far behind.::

Sergeant First Class Timothy Holloway.
We meet again, Corporal.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_met

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_met
::Salute.:: Corporal $(context.player.Name), sir.
You gave away your rank when you abandoned your duty, Holloway. I'm Corporal $(context.player.Name).

So, they've finally sent someone. I expected an army, but I got one $(#man/woman). ::He chuckles in a rather lifeless fashion.:: I never met you before, so you must have enlisted after I left the base. Welcome to Underrail Protectorate, Corporal - welcome to hell.
Perhaps, Corporal, perhaps... I know what I did - what we all did. But to these few men, I'm still Sarge. And in all honesty, that's what matters more to me.
Why did you leave Fort Apogee? What caused you to abandon your duty?
Your story changes everything. Maybe I can talk to the colonel and explain everything to him and convince him not to be too hard on you.
You are not hiding very well. The Protectorate knows you're here, as you can see.
I'm here to convince you to return to Fort Apogee and surrender.
I convinced the colonel to reduce your punishment. He will also start an investigation that is to determine if what you told me is true.
I need to leave, but I'll return again.
I think we're done here, Holloway. You'll get the Protectorate answer shortly.
I'm going to kill you all, you honorless bastards! ::Attack!::
But enough about that. Let's talk, Corporal.

So, Corporal, here you are. I expected an army, but I got one $(#man/woman). ::He chuckles in a rather lifeless fashion.:: I never met you before, so you must have enlisted after I had left the base. Welcome to Underrail Protectorate, Corporal - welcome to hell.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_toldStory

::He seems hesitant to speak. From the look in his eyes you draw a conclusion that there is an internal conflict within him; as if one side of him wants to give you an answer, while the other demands he does not.::
Corporal... the only thing we want is to be left alone. I think that is impossible, but if you're willing to give it a shot, then I have no objections.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_toldConvinceColonel

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_toldConvinceColonel
I never had any illusion that we'd escape the all-seeing eye of the Protectorate. We could have tried making a run for Core City but... we'd bite the dust long before we reached it.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_cathcart_persuadeToMitigatePunishment
You sound determined. So, you want me to return and what... be executed for desertion? I know you think I'm not the one who should talk of honor, but I don't see any honor in being shot like a pig.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_cathcart_persuadeToMitigatePunishment

::Holloway seems relieved.::

Well... it's better than I expected, it most certainly is...

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_convinceBetterOption

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_toldConvinceColonel

::He nods.:: My men will lead you out.

Thank you... Corporal.
I'll be waiting for it. Goodbye, Corporal. Have a good life.
I'm here to help you save your skin, Holloway. As well as your men's. And I can only do that if you tell me what happened.
I see you don't want to tell me that, fine. Let's ask a different question.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_toldStory

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_toldConvinceColonel
I'll be back once I've talked to the colonel.
Here, at least, we can stand proud, for now. We'll see what's going to happen.
You think you can evade the Protectorate forever?
::[Persuade]:: You can't escape court-martial, but, if you surrender peacefully, you might get off easier. It's still better than getting shot.
::[Intimidate]:: If you don't surrender now, you will be shot like a pig anyway. Not just you, all men you've basically led to death.
I have other questions.
You do have to return to Fort Apogee and turn in all your equipment. You will still face court-martial, but I doubt the punishment will be as severe.
::Leave.::

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_notTalkingAnymore
::Leave.::

::Holloway's eyes light up. Your words struck a chord with him, and you see he's about to open up.::

It's a long story... It's not one specific thing which happened that made me lead my men here. It's an ongoing problem I have had with the Protectorate. I am disappointed, and I'm furious at the same time. At both the Protectorate and myself.
::Holloway says nothing.::

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_evadeProtectorate
::He pauses.:: No... No I don't.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_evadeProtectorate

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_tryPersuade

::All eyes seem to be on Holloway. His men are standing still, waiting for his response. They know what he says next is going to be very crucial. He thinks long and hard, and then he looks at every single one of his men. No words are said, but you feel as if they're communicating. Soon, you get your answer.::
So I'll rot like a pig for the rest of my life? That's not an option I'm interested in.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_tryPersuade

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_tryIntimidate

::All eyes are on Holloway. His men are waiting for his crucial response. He thinks long and hard, and then he looks at every single one of his men. No words are said, but you feel as if they're communicating. Soon, you get your answer.::
They followed me willingly, Corporal. And if we're destined to be shot... like pigs if it must be so, then we'll do it as free men.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_tryIntimidate
Of course, Corporal.

That is something I'm willing to accept. Corporal, I must thank you for this. You've helped us so much.

We will head to Fort Apogee at once. ::He salutes you, then turns to his men.::

Alright, soldiers, let's move out.
Up_RenegadeDoneNegotiatingWithHolloway
Up_RenegadeDoneNegotiatingWithHolloway

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_toldStory
Go on, I'm all ears.
I don't see what could possibly make you abandon your duty, Holloway.
I mean, a whole platoon could be waiting in a dark tunnel to attack, for all I know. Maybe this is the end.
You convinced me, Corporal. We will surrender peacefully.
::Watch them as they leave.::

::Holloway takes a deep breath.::

Listen to me carefully, Corporal. I've been a proud member of Underrail Protectorate forces for years. I've fought and killed many, more than I'd like to admit, in order to save others, to protect others, to allow others to live better lives. But lately, that is not what I have been doing.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
originalText: context.npc_up_holloway_convinceToReturn
Glad you were reasonable, Holloway. Time to move.
Up_RenegadesLeave
Lately... I have been killing innocent people... and I have ordered my men to do the same.

::He turns to his men.:: We're moving out, soldiers. ASAP! Get your stuff and move out.

We're returning to Fort Apogee.
But... why?
No one is completely innocent.

Because *I* was ordered the same thing, Corporal. I didn't know who I was killing at the time. 

Raiders? Bad intel, but they're dead anyway - good job, Holloway! Good job, Sarge. Free Drones? Bad intel, those weren't the Free Drones, but they might have helped them at one point. Intel "suggested" so. Good job, Sarge! Good job!

Hogwash, Corporal! I don't know what the hell you're thinking, but an increasing number of people I was ordered to kill... we were ordered to kill weren't neither bandits, nor raiders, nor Free Drones. They were regular people. Some poor bastards get bullets between their eyes, and the excuse is always "bad intel." Bad intel, but good job, Sergeant Holloway. Good job! You did your duty.

Like they didn't care. Some of my superiors didn't even blink when I confronted them about it. "Who cares, they are all ratters!" - one lieutenant even said.

I felt like I'm crazy, derailed. It made me sick, that's not what I signed for, damn it!

I am not the only one who thinks that way, Corporal. See all these men? They felt betrayed too. Protectorate, now it seems to me, is not about protecting anyone but... about something I don't understand anymore. Maybe the people in charge changed, or maybe I was blind all along.

I tried to get to the colonel, but I was shot down long before I could even reach him. Officers, those bigots and sadists I confronted, started backstabbing me - spreading the word I'd gone mad! They knew what I was going to do and so they made their moves quicker than the blink of an eye.

I couldn't fight it! It felt like one of those dreams where you try to outrun something but you just cannot. You feel slow and sluggish as you run - like your legs are made of pure lead. And you try and you try... but you're too slow... My foes were always ahead of me, spreading their lies...

Eventually I realized it probably wouldn't do a damn thing even if I did manage to speak to the colonel. So I made a conscious decision to leave Fort Apogee with my men, who felt the same way I did.
::He sighs.:: That is all there is to it, Corporal. Those were my reasons for leaving Fort Apogee with my men.
